hobby_1_desc: I'm curious about everything — I have a chronic thirst for knowledge. If I see something I don't understand, my inner explorer kicks in, and I won't rest until I figure out exactly how it works. And yes, sometimes it takes me too far — but who said that's a bad thing?
hobby_2_desc: Video games are my saving point and an inexhaustible source of inspiration. They were the ones who whispered to me one day: “Let’s Ukrainianize this world?” — and since then I’ve been constantly translating, adapting, or modifying something. If I didn’t love games, I probably wouldn’t have delved so deeply into localization — but fate made the choice for me.
hobby_3_desc: Feel free to argue, but House M.D. remains the best TV show ever made. If you disagree, I have a cane with your name on it. Consider the hint delivered.
hobby_4_desc: Finding a book that truly hooks me is a full-blown quest with a “legendary” difficulty rating. But if such a book does appear, consider me gone — I vanish from reality entirely. And if you suddenly need me, just pray the book ends before that moment (and that it doesn’t turn out to have a sequel).
hobby_5_desc: I started describing my work in the form of blogs to explain what I do every day in a simple and accessible way. It helps me organize my thoughts while also sharing useful insights with others. Plus, the blog is a great place to admit that in the life of a localizer, there’s sometimes more detective work than in actual detective novels.
